answerText: enzymes[10]  Reversible enzyme inhibition occurs in roughly three types: two that are kinda confusing and easily mistakable for one another, and this kind, in which the substrate can't bind to the enzyme when the inhibitor is bound.

question: Question: The ping-pong and ternary-complex mechanisms are unusual models of the interactions of these proteins. [10] Name these proteins that bind to substrates and catalyze biological reactions
